abstract: <jats:p><jats:italic>Neoniphon pencei</jats:italic>, n. sp., is described from thirteen specimens, 132-197 mm standard length (SL) collected from mesophotic coral ecosystems (MCEs) at Rarotonga, Cook Islands by divers using mixed-gas closed-circuit rebreathers. It differs from all other species of the genus in number of lateral line scales, scales above and below lateral line, elements of life color, and in COI and cytochrome b DNA sequences. Of the five other known species of <jats:italic>Neoniphon</jats:italic>, it is most similar to the Indo-Pacific <jats:italic>N. aurolineatus</jats:italic> and the western Atlantic <jats:italic>N. marianus</jats:italic> both morphologically and genetically.</jats:p>
title: Neoniphon pencei, a new species of holocentrid (Teleostei: Beryciformes) from Rarotonga, Cook Islands
